MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.IO.FileOptions DeleteOnClose = int32(67108864)

Docs.summary: Indicates that a file is automatically deleted when it is no longer in use.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.IO.FileOptions Encrypted = int32(16384)

Docs.summary: Indicates that a file is encrypted and can be decrypted only by using the same user account used for encryption.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.IO.FileOptions None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Indicates that no additional options should be used when creating a object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.IO.FileOptions RandomAccess = int32(268435456)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the file is accessed randomly. The system can use this as a hint to optimize file caching.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.IO.FileOptions SequentialScan = int32(134217728)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the file is to be accessed sequentially from beginning to end. The system can use this as a hint to optimize file caching. If an application moves the file pointer for random access, optimum caching may not occur; however, correct operation is still guaranteed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Specifying this flag can increase performance for applications that read large files using sequential access. Performance gains can be even more noticeable for applications that read large files mostly sequentially, but occasionally skip over small ranges of bytes.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.IO.FileOptions WriteThrough = int32(-2147483648)

Docs.summary: Indicates that the system should write through any intermediate cache and go directly to disk.
